title: make shell TARGET=android fails on macOS 14.0 (Xcode 15)
body:
```
romanv@mac-mini-roman status-mobile % make shell TARGET=android 
Configuring Nix shell for target 'android'...
copying path '/nix/store/c236624d06jb5981n90c72qix2flng02-rsync-3.2.7' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/4ayajhcnz8h2gi0w1y1lr210gks1w5an-aws-sdk-cpp-1.11.37' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/v38q8qlpb3rl980aljs6j27fa9rzkkcr-boost-1.79.0' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/y6yq712j6dyyxgzl3zk75cisjwd6pphf-libarchive-3.6.2-lib' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/7mck4jr7wwg9m230lhwaji4gklp21f94-cctools-binutils-darwin-wrapper-973.0.1' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/9h4mq9n4yys73f8x056ya49bi5857g4y-ruby3.1.4-Ascii85-1.1.0' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/scnq03wk1379d8i67rglj39rzhrd7pnw-ruby3.1.4-coderay-1.1.3' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/isgq21hbkdpya3ss4gk6xw1cigk852ic-ruby3.1.4-asciidoctor-2.0.18' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/7q62dfd7cfq8j64rnv6jmxkw32rv8wib-ruby3.1.4-pygments.rb-2.3.0' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/fzzw0ncz38y3d75dwj43pzfbr2bc3ljm-ruby3.1.4-public_suffix-5.0.0' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/98a0ill39b0mh1bwf60qc7vsf41j3y09-ruby3.1.4-rouge-4.0.0' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/r1jvfxzhb51mdbww68kk7nx7p48gbj4h-ruby3.1.4-ruby-rc4-0.1.5' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/zx3331x5pigzmnw23mqbpri5jmiyqczv-clang-wrapper-11.1.0' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/fg8agj15p796nc2jipxfdr899ahm59rf-ruby3.1.4-treetop-1.6.11' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
copying path '/nix/store/vcc1m6hhnifcd6hqk7iip4zig2pw2ks6-ruby3.1.4-addressable-2.8.1' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
error: a 'x86_64-darwin' with features {} is required to build '/nix/store/w4zfrwjgd450m6ap9h5qfiq85jyyd04c-builder.pl.drv', but I am a 'aarch64-darwin' with features {benchmark, big-parallel, nixos-test}
```

```
romanv@mac-mini-roman status-mobile % file $(which nix)
/nix/var/nix/profiles/default/bin/nix: Mach-O 64-bit executable arm64
```


```
romanv@mac-mini-roman status-mobile % nix-shell -p nix-info --run "nix-info -m"  
 - system: `"aarch64-darwin"`
 - host os: `Darwin 23.0.0, macOS 14.0`
 - multi-user?: `yes`
 - sandbox: `no`
 - version: `nix-env (Nix) 2.13.4`
 - channels(root): `"nixpkgs"`
 - nixpkgs: `/nix/var/nix/profiles/per-user/root/channels/nixpkgs`
```

All of our CI hosts are using `13.x` so indeed `14.0` might be the cause of the issue:
```
 > a ci-slave-macos -o -a 'system_profiler SPSoftwareDataType | grep "System Version"' 
macm2-01.ih-eu-mda1.ci.release | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.5.1 (22G90)
maci7-01.ms-eu-dublin.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.2 (22D49)
macm2-02.ih-eu-mda1.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.4 (22F66)
macm1-01.ih-eu-mda1.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.5.2 (22G91)
macm2-01.ih-eu-mda1.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.4 (22F66)
maci7-03.ms-eu-dublin.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.1 (22C65)
maci7-02.ms-eu-dublin.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout)       System Version: macOS 13.1 (22C65)
```
I wonder if any other devs are on OSX 14.0 and whether they have this issue.

Sid suggest this is related, I'm not so sure:

* https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/issues/257686
@jakubgs is fix for it included to some release? If so is there a way to run it locally to check?

@rasom you can try a different Nix interpreter by using these commands:
```
source /nix/var/nix/profiles/default/etc/profile.d/nix-daemon.sh
nix-channel --update
nix-env --install --attr nixpkgs.nixVersions.nix_2_18
launchctl unload /Library/LaunchDaemons/org.nixos.nix-daemon.plist
launchctl load   /Library/LaunchDaemons/org.nixos.nix-daemon.plist
```
You can find the releases here: https://github.com/NixOS/nix/tags
Though upgrading might have unintended consequences.
Will try later today, thanks. Consequences... I think it is not a problem at the moment because I always can reset that mac.
I would avoid `nix_2_14` and `nix_2_15` as I recall issues with them.

`make shell TARGET=android` works for me

```
❯ sw_vers
ProductName:            macOS
ProductVersion:         14.0
BuildVersion:           23A344

❯ file $(which nix)
/nix/var/nix/profiles/default/bin/nix: Mach-O 64-bit executable arm64

❯ nix-shell -p nix-info --run "nix-info -m"
 - system: `"aarch64-darwin"`
 - host os: `Darwin 23.0.0, macOS 14.0`
 - multi-user?: `yes`
 - sandbox: `no`
 - version: `nix-env (Nix) 2.13.3`
 - channels(root): `"nixpkgs"`
 - nixpkgs: `/nix/var/nix/profiles/per-user/root/channels/nixpkgs`
 ```

>  - version: `nix-env (Nix) 2.13.3`

I have

> - version: `nix-env (Nix) 2.13.4`
 
 the only difference I see

upgraded to `2_18` and now error looks like this 
```
copying path '/nix/store/ly3wj661lbrgh5gj07kfx0y8cyqygrl0-zstd-1.5.5' from 'https://cache.nixos.org'...
error:
       … while calling the 'derivationStrict' builtin

         at /builtin/derivation.nix:9:12: (source not available)

       … while evaluating derivation 'status-mobile-shell'
         whose name attribute is located at /nix/store/vcj90ksw5vk6ia960b73vpncxa9pw826-source/pkgs/stdenv/generic/make-derivation.nix:303:7

       … while evaluating attribute 'buildInputs' of derivation 'status-mobile-shell'

         at /nix/store/vcj90ksw5vk6ia960b73vpncxa9pw826-source/pkgs/stdenv/generic/make-derivation.nix:350:7:

          349|       depsHostHost                = lib.elemAt (lib.elemAt dependencies 1) 0;
          350|       buildInputs                 = lib.elemAt (lib.elemAt dependencies 1) 1;
             |       ^
          351|       depsTargetTarget            = lib.elemAt (lib.elemAt dependencies 2) 0;

       (stack trace truncated; use '--show-trace' to show the full trace)

       error: a 'x86_64-darwin' with features {} is required to build '/nix/store/w4zfrwjgd450m6ap9h5qfiq85jyyd04c-builder.pl.drv', but I am a 'aarch64-darwin' with features {benchmark, big-parallel, nixos-test}
 ```

Previously I was mainly focused on trying to run iOS version of the app locally, so just to make sure no part of it had any affect on results of running `make shell TARGET=android` I reset device again and reproduced that error with those steps:

0. clean Mac, macOS 14
1. install Xcode 15
2. install brew
3. restart (just in case because on previous attempts there were some issues during nix installation which according to some gh issues are fixed with restart `¯\_(ツ)_/¯`, and they are)
4. `brew install git`
5. `brew install coreutils`
6. clone `status-mobile` repo
7. `make shell TARGET=android`

same result
```
error: a 'x86_64-darwin' with features {} is required to build '/nix/store/w4zfrwjgd450m6ap9h5qfiq85jyyd04c-builder.pl.drv', but I am a 'aarch64-darwin' with features {benchmark, big-parallel, nixos-test}
(use '--show-trace' to show detailed location information)
```

@jakubgs I'm wondering also whether I can somehow pass `--show-trace` through `make shell TARGET=android` in order to get a full stack (if that would be helpful though).

```
% sw_vers
ProductName:		macOS
ProductVersion:		14.0
BuildVersion:		23A344

% file $(which nix)                                                                            
/nix/var/nix/profiles/default/bin/nix: Mach-O 64-bit executable arm64

% nix-shell -p nix-info --run "nix-info -m"

 - version: `nix-env (Nix) 2.13.4`
 - channels(root): `"nixpkgs"`
 - nixpkgs: `/nix/var/nix/profiles/per-user/root/channels/nixpkgs`
```

can it be related to this line?
https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/9078c3b61bd34af3c6be6a5edf861bed6df9d8ca/nix/scripts/shell.sh#L59

as far as I can tell if I comment out that line I get that `builder.pl` built successfully
